abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First Renewable Energy
            for Rural Economic Development Project for Sri Lanka were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory; GEO outcomes were also
            satisfactory; risk to development outcome was low or
            negligible; risk to GEO outcome was also low or negligible;
            Bank performance was satisfactory and the borrower
            performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            includes: long term involvement is very important. A quality
            implementation body is vital. Private sector market growth
            should be carefully managed where possible. Stakeholder
            consultation throughout the project cycle is necessary. Risk
            analysis should be carried out also during implementation.
            Performance-based incentives to selected developers are key
            in enabling communities to get expert support. Prepare well
            for project closure. World Bank involvement added credibility.
